Click to schedule a tour. "The finest clubs, like family traditions, trace their roots to strong contributions by individuals. These individuals create the environment in which camaraderie flourishes and new friendships begin. These individuals are called Members.” LIVE THE LEGEND! For membership information, call Chief Operating Officer & Director of Membership, Tom Brun at 262-968-9717. © Copyright 2025. All rights reserved. About Us - Legends Golf Course and Villas - Legends Golf Course & Villas Sun - Sat: 7:00am-5:00pm Home Stay and Play Membership Newsletter About Us Blog Contact Us Book A Room Book a Tee Time About Us The Legends Experience Legends is more than just a championship golf course, we are a community guided by our mission to provide exceptional experiences. We’ve created a welcoming space where players of all levels and their families feel right at home. Our culture is rooted in hospitality, family-friendly values, and a dedication to fostering connections both on and off the course. From our dedicated staff to our vibrant community of members and guests, the Legends family is at the heart of everything we do. OUR MISSION At the heart of Legends is a simple mission: to provide exceptional experiences that leave a lasting impression. We’re committed to excellence in every detail, from the quality of our golf course to the comfort of our accommodations . Our dedicated staff is the cornerstone of this mission, delivering service that consistently earns glowing reviews . Every member of our team goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome, valued, and cared for. We also believe in flexibility and customization. Whether you’re organizing a large group outing, planning a romantic weekend getaway, or joining us for a family vacation, we work with you to tailor your visit to your unique needs. Finally, Legends is more than a destination; it’s a community. Our vibrant network of members and guests fosters connection and camaraderie. From members-only events to casual gatherings, we bring people together to celebrate the joys of golf and the beauty of shared experiences. OUR CULTURE The culture at Legends is built on a foundation of inclusivity, family-friendly values, and a welcoming spirit. We believe golf is for everyone, from experienced players to first-timers, and we strive to create an environment where all feel at home. Legends is a place where families create lifelong memories, friends gather to unwind, and guests are treated like part of the family. Our facilities and amenities cater to all ages, offering something for everyone—from stunning fairways to fishing ponds, cozy firepits, and serene sunsets over the Hill Country. OUR AMENITIES Legends Golf Course & Villas offers a complete experience beyond the fairways. Our championship golf course provides a stunning yet challenging layout designed to test and delight players of all skill levels. Whether you're here for a casual round or preparing for a tournament , our beautifully maintained course ensures an exceptional game. Off the course, guests can enjoy a range of amenities, including comfortable accommodations, a sparkling pool, and fire pits perfect for unwinding after a day on the greens. Families and groups will love our fishing pond, walking trails, and scenic views that showcase the beauty of the Texas Hill Country . For those looking to sharpen their skills, our driving range is the perfect place to warm up before a round or fine-tune your swing. Our practice facilities include spacious hitting areas and putting greens to help you perfect every aspect of your game. If you’re new to golf or looking for expert guidance, lessons and clinics are available to help you elevate your play. At Legends, we pride ourselves on offering not just a world-class golf experience but also a welcoming environment where guests can relax, connect, and create lasting memories. STAY CONNECTED Be a part of the Legends story! Follow us on social media to stay updated on our latest happenings, special events, and news. You can also join our newsletter for exclusive offers, insider tips, and all the updates you need to plan your next visit. JOIN THE LEGENDS FAMILY Legends Golf Course & Villas is more than a premier golfing destination—it’s a place where people come to connect, relax, and celebrate the good things in life. Whether you’re here for a round of golf, an extended stay, or just to enjoy the natural beauty of the Texas Hill Country, you’ll find that Legends feels like home. We invite you to experience the warmth, hospitality, and community that set us apart. Contact us today to plan your visit, inquire about membership , or learn more about what makes Legends so special. We can’t wait to welcome you to the family! Book A Tee Time Stay And Play Golf Packages CONTACT 105 Rangeway Cir Kingsland, TX 78639 833-525-4653 resort@legendslbj.com LINKS DASHBOARD RESOURCES SITE MAP CALENDAR Copyright 2025 Legends Golf and Villas , all rights reserved Join & Save Big! Staff - The Legends Golf Club Skip to main content Skip to footer The Legends Golf Club Golf Home About The Legends Tee Times Book a Tee Time Golf Course Policies Rates Memberships Instruction Legendary Golf Tips Ladies and Couples Golf at The Legends Junior Golf at The Legends GC PGA HOPE at The Legends GC Franklin Golf Club 2025 Celebrate Weddings Golf Outings Special Events Legendary Celebration Tips The Legendary Kitchen Food Truck Course Info Staff Gift Cards Newsletter Book Tee Times Staff The Legends Golf Club Staff Ted Bishop PGA Professional 38th President of the PGA of America General Manager Ted Bishop is the PGA General Manager and Class A GCSAA Superintendent at The Legends Golf Club. He has been at The Legends  Golf Club since it was constructed in 1991. Bishop Graduated from Purdue University in 1976 with a degree in Agronomy/Turf Management. Prior to moving to Franklin he was at the Phil Harris Golf Course in Linton, IN as the pro/superintendent from 1976-91. Bishop served as the President of the PGA of America in 2013-2014. During his term he was an activist for recreational golfers and their enjoyment of the game. He was instrumental in creating a close working relationship between the PGA of America and the PGA Tour serving two years on the Tour Policy Board. Bishop named public facilities such as Harding Park and Bethpage Black as PGA Championship and Ryder Cup sites. He worked closely with Arnold Palmer in the establishment of the Deacon Palmer Award which annually recognizes PGA members who have overcome a major obstacle in the career and served the game in an impactful way. He served on the rules committee at six Masters and two US opens. Bishop is a native to Logansport, IN.  He is a member of the Indiana Golf Hall of Fame and is a two-time recipient of the Sagamore of the Wabash from the Governor of Indiana. He is a former Indiana PGA Golf Professional of the Year and has received numerous awards from the Indiana PGA. Bishop has been married since 1976 to wife, Cindy. The couple has two daughters; Ashely (Ted) Davidson- Event Coordinator at The Legends GC; and Ambry (Tony) Santillo- St. John’s University women’s golf coach and PGA assistant professional at Saint Andrews Golf Club in New York. Ted and Cindy have two grandchildren; Reid and Remy Davidson. Email Ted Ashely Davidson Member, Event and Wedding Coordinator Hello! My name is Ashely Davidson! My career in golf began long ago. I grew up playing junior golf in Indiana, played for Franklin Community High School, and ultimately went to the University of Kansas on a full golf scholarship. While at Kansas I participated in every tournament and earned Big 12 Conference and All Academic honors every season, and Most Valuable Player in 2002. After college I served on the Indiana Women’s Golf Association and was the founder of the Central Indiana Executive Women’s Golf Association Indianapolis Center. I also graduated from Leadership Johnson County in 2013, and chaired the LJC Wine dinner in 2016 and 2017, featuring more than 300 guests! Professionally after college I worked shortly at Eli Lily before coming to work as the membership coordinator at The Legends. After being in membership my job stretched into the planning and execution of events here at The Legends. I do all the planning for anything from a golf event to a wedding. Beginning in 2018 my job morphed into being in charge of all the catering, cooking, purchasing, and planning of events both onsite and off with our food truck. Many people at the course might say they barely see me but thats because I spend so much time in the back kitchen prepping and making food or I am on the food trucking getting things ready. I cant be the glue that holds this place together sitting at my desk! I feel lucky because I get to work with my parents, husband, and coworkers (that I call my friends) on a day to day basis. I especially felt that in 2019 when I became a breast cancer survivor and my co-workers   and family helped cover my responsibilities. That is what I love most about working at The Legends is that whenever someone needs help everyone slides over and helps where they are needed. Outside my work I enjoy spending time with my kids and watching whatever activity they are involved in! Email Ashely Ted Davidson Facility Manager, Food Truck Operator My name is Ted Davidson I grew up in Southport, Indiana and went to Southport High School and earned a Bachelors of Science Degree in Recreational Sports Management from Indiana University graduating in 2001. I have been employed at The Legends Golf Club since 2009. I grew up in the Lumber Business Davidson Industries a 80 year old family business that we as a family decided to sell in 2005. I continued to work in the lumber business till 2009 when i decided to take up a job at The Legends. I started out working a season Par 3/Dye building and have worked my way around the facility spending time in each department learning the overall big picture here at the club. I find that is the best way to get to know a facility or any business. When a person spends time in each area of a business they have a better understanding of the day to day procedures that are valuable in running a business. I spent 6 years in the pro shop learning customer service and how to handle many situations. Through those 6 years I spent stints in the cart barn and grounds maintenance learning and helping with day to day operations. In 2016 The Legends purchased a food truck to cater our own events/golf outings, and since the purchase of the truck I have spilt my time operating the truck with my wife Ashely and also taking care of the overall golf course facility. This is a big place with 300 acres and many buildings there is always repairs and upkeep needed around the facility. I have enjoyed my 15 years at The Legends Golf Club and each day presents something new. Email Ted Crystal Morse PGA Head Professional Crystal is a 15-year PGA of America Member and a native to Greenwood, Indiana. As a former standout junior golfer at Center Grove HS, Morse went on to play at Western Kentucky University, where she was named to the All-Sunbelt conference team and served as captain of the WKU team her junior and senior years. Upon graduating in 2003, she spent two seasons as an Assistant Professional at The Legends, before moving to Palm Dessert, California. While in California she earned her PGA of America Membership and spent 9 seasons as the Assistant Professional at The Lakes Country Club, a 36-hole private club. She then moved on to The Club at Morningside in Rancho Mirage, CA at Morningside she became the lead teaching instructor. She returned to The Legends in 2017 as the Director of Player Development and then quickly became the Head PGA Professional. Today, in addition to her position at The Legends, Morse serves as Co-Head Coach of the Franklin Boys and Girls High School teams and is co-owner of The Morse Golf Academy at The Legends with her husband Jim, a fellow PGA of America Golf Professional, where they teach over 1,500 private lessons per year! Crystal and Jim have two children, Carson (12) and Cali (10) who also enjoy spending time at the course and playing in the PGA junior league. Along with daily golf operations, Crystal enjoys running Junior and Adult Player Development Programs including PGA Jr league, Get Golf Ready, PGA HOPE (Military Veterans), First Tee, and LPGA*USGA Girls Golf Events! Crystal received the Indiana Section Youth Player Development Award in 2019 and 2020, was recently awarded the PGA National Player Development Award and named one of the top instructors in Indiana by Golf Digest for 2024! Email Crystal Jim Morse PGA Director of Instruction Contact Jim: 760-567-5995 or jimmorse1@yahoo.com Jim was born and raised in Washington state and began his golf career at the The Couer d’Alene, Idaho during his inaugural season in 1991. After Spending a season at one of the top resorts in the country Jim was offered a position at The Vintage Club in Indian Wells, California. After 3 seasons at The Vintage Club Jim took a position at the exclusive Eldorado Country Club also located in Indian Wells, California. While there Jim became a PGA member and enjoyed a 20-year career as both Assistant and Head professional at the club. In 2015 Jim and his family moved to Greenwood where he became Director of Instruction at GOLFTEC Castleton before coming to The Legends Golf Club in April of 2018 where he became the Director of Instruction and where he founded and built the Morse Golf Academy which opened up in February of 2020. Nicholas Norton Assistant Golf Professional My name is Nicholas Norton, but most people know me as Nick. I’m originally from Homestead, FL but I have been in the golf business for almost a decade and look forward to many more years here at The Legends Golf Club! I am currently enrolled in the PGA PGM program seeking to become a member of the PGA of America. My experience in the golf world is vast and includes being an outside attendant, pro shop manager, and everything in between. Here at The Legends I am responsible for assisting with golf Handicaps, Club Repair, Wednesday Men’s Choose up league, and of course making sure our patrons have an amazing time while visiting The Legends Golf Club. Email Nick Tony Clecak Tony Clecak passed away on June 15, 2024 at the age of 92 .  The Legends will forever be thankful for his positive influence and commitment to being a true PGA Professional. A 44 year member of the PGA, Clecak served as the President of the Indiana Section PGA in 1983 and 1984. During his tenure as an Indiana Section PGA board of Director he also served on the Tournament, Club Relations and Public Relations Committees. He is a past recipient of the Indiana PGA Bill Strausbaugh Award, Teacher of the Year Award,  Junior Leader Award and he was the 1985 Indiana Golf Professional of the Year. Nationally was a member of the PGA of America’s Business School Teaching Staff from 1972 to 1986 and he was elected as the 30th Master Professional of the PGA of American in 1986! Tony has also had an amazing playing career as well! He played in the US Amateur Tournament in 1962. He is the winner of the Indiana PGA Senior Championship, he also played on tour from 1972-1973. He passion has long been teaching the game of golf. During his PGA career he gave over 25,000 lessons to students of all ages and abilities! Ethan Blake Front Desk Attendant Ethan is a recent graduate of IUPUI and is originally from Frankton, IN! He has been with the course since 2021 and enjoys all the wonderful things that go into the course! Ethan also helps on the Legendary Kitchen and loves to help out anywhere he can on the course! His favorite part about the course how wonderful it is seeing people enjoy the course because it really feels like all your hard work pays off! The Legends Cart Barn Staff Roger Morrow Cart Barn Manager Roger has been with The Legends for many years and has vast knowledge on all things golf! He works hard to make sure that events and outings are extremely successful and works even harder to make sure that all of our equipment is up to date and working proper! Rogers favorite part of the course is how everything comes together so we can have one of the best courses in the state! Dick Million Cart Barn Manager Dick has been with The Legends for a few years now and is even a member of the course himself! He is even one of our first Legacy members! He works very hard to make sure he is doing everything he can to ensure the success of the course. Dick enjoys to play golf and walk Watson on his days off! His favorite part of the course is taking Watson for walks and enjoying the wonderful customers we have at The Legends! Legendary Baker Expert Mouser , Freelance Hunter Baker has been with the course her entire life! She is a great employee and possibly the best hunter in the area. Her duties include greeting customers and allowing them to pet her, she also loves to nap in the sun making sure to fully relax while at work. She loves getting treats and trying to sleep in Ted Bishops office chair. Her main duty is making sure she keeps the facility free and clear of all pest and other things which she has mastered during her time at the legends. If you see Baker don’t be afraid to to stop and say Hi just make sure you have a pocket full of treats! The Legends Golf Club Maintenance Shane Thompson Head Mechanic Shane is a native of Columbus, IN. I currently live in Shelby County, IN. I have studied at Indiana University and have always been drawn to mechanical repairs and I especially love the great outdoors! I enjoy hiking, canoeing, and gardening. I also enjoy spending time with my wife Kelly and son Maurice and our pets when I can! Shanes favorite part about the course is how hard everyone works to make it all look so beautiful! Pat Cunningham Irrigation and Maintenance Pat has been with the course going on 32 years! He has been with the course since the beginning and has an extremely vast knowledge on all things around the course! He oversees every irrigation project and he always there as soon as anything goes wrong! Pats favorite part about the course is how well things are maintained and how wonderful it always looks! Larry Myers Irrigation and Maintenance Larry has been with the course for a decade and has a lot of experience with the course! He helps with all things irrigation and is always willing to lend a hand with any project in maintenance! His favorite part of the course is how wonderful the water and grass looks in the summer! Legendary Watson Assistant to the Superintendent , Professional Stick Chewer Watson is one of the core members here at The Legends and he is a key component when it comes to getting work done outside! His duties vary but he is great at making sure all of the sticks in the area are chewed up and brought right to your feet! He also loves playing in the water and getting his daily swim at any of our many bodies of water. So if you see something going through the water take another look because it could be Watson! He also enjoys belly rubs and showing you all of his toys. He makes sure to run the course as much as he can because being Assistant to the Superintendent is a lot more work than you think. So if you see him make sure to stop by and say hi and tell him what a great job he is doing! Contact - Chingford Golf Course Skip to main content Chingford Golf Course London, England Home Gallery Flyover Visitors Clubs Hire Equipment Contact Online Booking Member Booking Visitor Booking Food at Chingford Golf Course Book Tee Times Contact Contact Chingford Golf Course 4 Bury Road, Chingford, London, England E4 7QJ Phone : 020 8529 2085 Email : chingfordgolfcourse@cityoflondon.gov.uk Social Media : How to find us By train Chingford Golf Course is served by London Overground from London Liverpool Street Station. Trains arrive and depart every 15 minutes. London Overground Chingford From Chingford station to the course is just a five minute walk. For walking directions, please visit Google Maps . For help planning your journey, we recommend Transport for London’s Journey Planner . By car Chingford Golf Course can be reached from most of London and Essex. For help planning your route by road, we recommend Google Maps . Free parking is available at Bury Road, located directly adjacent to the café and golf shop. By bus Chingford is easily reached by bus from across North and East London using routes 97, 179, 212, 313, 379, 385, 397 and 444. For help planning your journey by bus, we recommend Transport for London’s Journey Planner . Copyright © 2025 Chingford Golf Course All Rights Reserved.
